text: Her mæg findan, se ðe secan wile, hu micel þæs geargeteles is aurnen fram Adame & fram Euan his wife & fram frymðe middaneardes to ðam flode, þæt wæs ðonne geargerimes twa ðusenda wintra & twahund wintra & twa & feowertyg wintra.
Þonne wæs fram þam flode þa forð to Abrahames acennednesse nigan hund wintra & feowertyg wintra.
Þonne wæs fram Abrahames acennednesse forð oð Moyses gebyrdtidu & þara Israhela bearna gefære of Egyptum, þæt wæs ðonne fif hund wintra & fif & hundteontig wintra.
Þonne wæs fram Moyses gebyrdtide þa forð to Salomones gebyrde & his mæran frumgeweorces ðæs temples on Hierusalem, þæt is ðonne feower hund wintra & eahta & hundseofantyg wintra.
Þonne wæs ealles aurnen geargerimes fram frymðe middaneardes oþ Cristes acennednesse fif ðusend wintra & eahta & twentig wintra.
Þa wæs fram frymðe ealles aurnen oþ þæs temples geweorc, þæt sindon feower þusenda wintra & an hund wintra & seofan & syxtig wintra.
Nu we magon secan & eaðe findan hwæt þara wyrhtena wæs þe þone stan bæron to ðam weorce. ða man þæt mære Salomones tempell worhte, þæt is hund seofantyg ðusenda.
& ðus fela wæs ðara ðe þone stan snidan & fegdon, þæt wæs hund eahtatig þusenda.
& þara gerefena wæs þreo ðusenda & eac ðreo hund þe þa men bewiston ætþam temple.
& þæt tempel wæs on seofan gearan geworht on þam monþe þe we October nemnað.
& þæs temples længe wæs syxtig fæðma & seo widnes wæs twentig fæþma & his heahnys wæs þritig fæþma.
Na hyrde we to soðe siþþan seccgan þæt on ðære ealdan æ ænig wurde hus aræred swylic þæt mære wæs.
& þonne wæs fram þæs temples geweorce to Cristes ðrowunge twaþusdenda wintra & seofon & ðrytig wintra.
Þonne wæs fram frymþe, oð Romana burh wearð getimbrad, ealles aurnen feower ðusenda wintra & feower hund wintra & feower & hundeahtatyg wintra.
Fram ðære burge geweorce oð Cristes gebyrdtide wæs ða agan seofan hund wintra.
Ðonne is nu fram frymþe ealles aurnen syxþusenda wintra & an hund wintra & twa & þrytyg wintra.
To ðæm eastrun þe bið IIII Non. apr & bið se bissextus þy ilcan geare & þaindictionesXV.
